required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Evaluate The Effect Of Food On How Tasocitinib (CP-690,550) Is Absorbed And Moves Through The Body Following Oral Administration Of Tasocitinib (CP-690,550) Tablets To Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, 2-Period, 2-Sequence, Open Label, Single Dose, Cross-Over Study To Evaluate The Effect Of Food On Pharmacokinetics Of Tasocitinib (CP-690,550) Tablets In Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, a 10 mg tasocitinib (CP-690,550) tablet will be administered to healthy subjects on two separate dosing occasions. On one occasion the tasocitinib (CP-690,550) tablet will be administered in a fasting condition; On the other occasion the tasocitinib (CP-690,550) tablet will be administered in a fed condition following a standard breakfast meal. The amount of tasocitinib (CP-690,550) in the blood will be measured at various times over 24 hours following each dosing occasion and compared to evaluate for any differences.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the effect of food on the pharmacokinetics of tasocitinib (CP-690,550).

primary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples out to 24 hours post dose in each of two periods.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUClast, Tmax, and t1/2 of tasocitinib (CP-690,550).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples out to 24 hours post dose in each of two periods.
Pre-dose on Day O of Period 1 and post-dose on Day 2 of Period 2.
Prior to dosing in Period 1 and 2.

intervention.description: Single dose of tasocitinib (CP-690,550) 10 mg under fed conditions.
Single dose of tasocitinib (CP-690,550) 10 mg under fasted conditions.
Single dose of tasocitinib (CP-690,550) 10 mg under fasted conditions.
Single dose of tasocitinib (CP-690,550) 10 mg under fed conditions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and/or female (non-childbearing potential) subjects between the ages of 21 and 55 years.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 17.5 to 30.5 kg/m2; and a total body weight for males>50 kg (110 lbs). For females, total body weight >45 kg (99 lbs).
- No evidence of active or latent or inadequately treated infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis (TB)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of any clinically significant illness, medical condition, or disease.
- Evidence or history of any clinically significant infections within the past 3 months.
- Use of tobacco- or nicotine-containing products in excess of the equivalent of 5 cigarettes per day.
